subject: Education
title: Sleep and Memory Consolidation
description: Learn Sleep and Memory Consolidation in one minute.

hook.text: Students who slept after studying remembered 40% more than those who pulled all-nighters.

buildup.text: During sleep, the brain replays the day's experiences, strengthening important connections.

discovery.text: Slow-wave sleep consolidates facts; REM sleep integrates them into existing knowledge networks.

twist.text: Even a 20-minute nap after learning produces measurable memory benefits.

climax.text: Sleep deprivation impairs memory formation as much as being legally drunk.

punchline.text: The hardest-working organ in your body does its best work while you sleep.

quiz.question: How does sleep affect memory consolidation?
options: The brain replays and strengthens important connections during sleep stages
Only dreams contribute to memory formation
